definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: The commander ordered that all civilians (should) be evacuated.
sentences.chinese: 司令员命令撤退所有平民。

sentences.english: The commander countermanded the reinforcements to the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 司令员下令撤回派往战场的援军。

sentences.english: Pai Ch'ung-hsi then took over as principal of the aviation academy and as commander of the air force.
sentences.chinese: 随后白崇禧作为空军司令员和航空学院校长接管空军。

sentences.english: Naaman was the commander of the Syrian army.
sentences.chinese: 乃缦是亚兰王军队的司令员。

sentences.english: The commander commended the soldier for his bravery.
sentences.chinese: 司令员表扬这名士兵的勇敢。

sentences.english: One day, deputy commander of talk with huang feng.
sentences.chinese: 这天，副司令员找黄鸣锋谈话。

sentences.english: The commander ordered that all civilians(should)be evacuated.
sentences.chinese: 司令员命令所有平民撤出。

sentences.english: The commander concentrated a powerful force on the left flank.
sentences.chinese: 司令员把强大兵力集中在左翼。

sentences.english: The commander was recalled from the frontline.
The commander also cannot protect him.
The commander ordered that troops (should) set off at once.
sentences.chinese: 司令员命令部队马上出发。

sentences.english: The commander asked all officers to abandon the idea of liberalism.
sentences.chinese: 司令员要求各级指战员不能有自由主义思想。

sentences.english: General Liu has troops waiting to fall on the enemy from the rear.
sentences.chinese: 刘司令员已经派部队等着从后面袭击敌人。

sentences.english: The commander brought up his reserve troops.
sentences.chinese: 司令员把后备部队调了上来。

sentences.english: At this time, the guards to remind, deputy commander of the set out to meet xu commander.
sentences.chinese: 这时，警卫员来提醒副司令员，该出发去接许司令了。

sentences.english: The commander sent out troops to stop the enemy's backup troops.
sentences.chinese: 司令员派出部队阻遏敌人的援兵。

definition: political commissar (during Russian and Chinese communist revolutions)
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
Song Renqiong (1909-2005), general of the People's Liberation Army

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
